Class SetUpPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • SetUpPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SetUpPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Instances of SetUpPanel are components of Game objects. They contain all components related to setting up a game, including components to create a team, heroes, and cities. SetUpPanel objects are shown at the start of a new Game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void addContentPanel()
      Creates a JPanel below the title to hold the main content of the set up page, and gives it a CardLayout to hold the different panels shown during game set up.
      private void addHeroInfoPanels()
      Adds an information panel for each hero to the hero info panel card layout, using the hero's type as the String reference.
      private void addHeroSummaries()
      Adds the hero summaries to the team summary panel.
      private void addSubPanels()
      Creates a JPanel for every sub-panel within the main content panel, and adds them to the CardLayout.
      private void addTitle()
      Creates a label containing the game's title and adds it to the panel.
      private javax.swing.JPanel heroSummaryPanel(Hero hero)
      Takes a hero, and produces a panel containing the hero's image, name and type.
      private void initialiseAddHeroPanel()
      Adds components to the add hero panel.
      private void initialiseCreateTeamPanel()
      Add components to the create team panel.
      private void initialiseInputPanel()
      Adds components to the input panel.
      private void initialiseStartScreenPanel()
      Adds components to the start screen panel.
      private void initialiseTeamSummaryPanel()
      Adds components to the team summary panel.
      private javax.swing.JPanel makeHeroInfoPanel(Hero hero)
      Takes a hero subclass instance, and creates an information panel for a hero of that type, including its image, type, special ability, max health and description.
      private void refreshAddHeroPanel()
      Called after each hero is added.
      private void refreshTeamSummaryPanel()
      Shows the team name, and creates an information panel for each hero in the team.
      private Team team()
      Helper method to return the team of the current GameEnvironment.

      • addSubPanels

        private void addSubPanels()
        Creates a JPanel for every sub-panel within the main content panel, and adds them to the CardLayout. Sets the start screen panel to be show initially.

      • makeHeroInfoPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel makeHeroInfoPanel(Hero hero)
        Takes a hero subclass instance, and creates an information panel for a hero of that type, including its image, type, special ability, max health and description.
        Parameters:
        hero - An instance of the hero subclass which the information panel is describing.
        Returns:
        The hero information JPanel.

      • refreshAddHeroPanel

        private void refreshAddHeroPanel()
        Called after each hero is added. Updates the add hero panel by updating the hero number, emptying the name text field, and resetting the selected hero type the the default.

      • initialiseTeamSummaryPanel

        private void initialiseTeamSummaryPanel()
        Adds components to the team summary panel.

      • addHeroSummaries

        private void addHeroSummaries()
        Adds the hero summaries to the team summary panel. Called once the team has been created.

      • heroSummaryPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel heroSummaryPanel(Hero hero)
        Takes a hero, and produces a panel containing the hero's image, name and type.
        Parameters:
        hero - The hero for which to make a summary panel.
        Returns:
        A summary panel for the given hero.

      • refreshTeamSummaryPanel

        private void refreshTeamSummaryPanel()
        Shows the team name, and creates an information panel for each hero in the team. Called once the team of heroes has been created.
